titleInfo.title: Pflueger v. Social Security Administration
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER that the Plaintiff, Mark D. Plueger shall supplement his Application to Proceed without Prepayment of Fees 2 by identifying the source of the money, the amount received, and the amount he expects to continue to receive in explanation for his response to question no. 3. The supplement shall be filed on or before January 31, 2007. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (MKR )

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 4:06-cv-03292; Pflueger v. Social Security Administration;
extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER that the Plaintiff, Mark D. Plueger shall supplement his Application to Proceed without Prepayment of Fees 2 by identifying the source of the money, the amount received, and the amount he expects to continue to receive in explanation for his response to question no. 3. The supplement shall be filed on or before January 31, 2007. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (MKR )

titleInfo.title: Pflueger v. Social Security Administration
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - The Plaintiff's application to proceed in forma pauperis 2 isgranted. The filing of the Complaint shall not incur any payment of fees. The Clerk shall issue the proper summonses. If requested to do so, the United States Marshal shall serve all process in this case without prepayment of fees from the plaintiff or security therefor. This Order is entered without prejudice to the Court later entering an order taxing costs in this case. No one, including the Plaintiff, is relieved by this Order from the obligation to pay or to reimburse taxable costs after the completion of this action. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp.(JAE, )

titleInfo.title: Pflueger v. Social Security Administration
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - The Plaintiff's Amended Motion for an Enlargement of Time within whichto file his brief in support of the appeal 17 is granted. The briefing schedule is amended as follows: a. The Plaintiff shall file and serve a brief on or before July 31, 2007; and b. The Defendant shall file and serve a brief on or before August 31, 2007. The Clerk is directed to terminate the duplicate motion at 15. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp.(JAE, )

titleInfo.title: Pflueger v. Social Security Administration
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 21 Motion for Leave to file an affidavit 21; The Affidavit of counsel filed as Attachment 1 at filing 21, is hereby substituted for the statement of counsel identified in the Plaintiff's Index of Evidence at filing 20. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp.(MKR)

titleInfo.title: Pflueger v. Social Security Administration
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 24 Motion for Leave to File a reply brief. Brief shall be no more than ten pages in length and shall be filed on or before Monday, September 17, 2007. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (POK)

titleInfo.title: Pflueger v. Social Security Administration
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER - The decision of the Commissioner is affirmed, the appeal is denied, and judgment in favor of the Defendant will be entered in a separate document. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (JAE, )
